page.title: 04 CANOEING ON THE MEDWAY
page.content:
The longest paddle I have been on so far was from the Club House to the {lock.}I passed two rather bashed-up boats but the rest were pretty well looked after. There were two old petrol drums for boats on the river and a small boat shop. Halfway up the river is where it is most green and unpolluted. When I got there I could see a mother duck and about four baby ducks behind her. At the lock I pulled myself up and looked over the lock - it was a long way down. Then I paddled back. When I passed the{Malta Inn} there were people outside with drinks and they waved at me as I passed.
by Gary Shearing
